# Example Requirements Document

## Course Enrollment Platform

We need a web platform for course enrollment where students can browse available courses, enroll, and make payments.

### Goals
- Students can browse and search for courses
- Students can enroll in courses online
- Students can pay for courses securely
- Admins can manage the course catalog
- Generate reports for finance team

### Constraints
- Budget: less than $150 per month for hosting
- Prefer AWS infrastructure
- Must release MVP in 6 weeks
- Must comply with PCI-DSS for payment processing
- Support up to 1,000 concurrent users initially

### Features

1. **User Authentication**
   - Student and admin login
   - Password reset functionality
   - Email verification

2. **Course Catalog**
   - List all available courses
   - Course details page (description, instructor, schedule, price)
   - Filter by category, price, schedule

3. **Search Functionality**
   - Search courses by name, instructor, or keywords
   - Auto-complete suggestions

4. **Shopping Cart**
   - Add/remove courses
   - View total price
   - Apply discount codes

5. **Checkout & Payment**
   - Integrate with Stripe for payment processing
   - Support credit card payments
   - Email confirmation after successful payment

6. **Admin Dashboard**
   - CRUD operations for courses
   - Manage instructors
   - View enrollment statistics

7. **Reports**
   - Revenue reports by course
   - Enrollment trends
   - Export to CSV

### Stakeholders
- Students (primary users)
- Course administrators
- Finance team
- System administrators

### Technical Hints
- React for frontend
- Node.js/Express for backend
- PostgreSQL database
- AWS hosting (EC2 + RDS)
- Stripe for payments

requirements.summary: A web platform for course enrollment allowing students to browse, enroll, and make payments for courses, while providing admins the ability to manage the course catalog and generate finance reports.
goals: Students can browse and search for courses
Students can enroll in courses online
Students can pay for courses securely
Admins can manage the course catalog
constraints: Budget: less than $150 per month for hosting
Must comply with PCI-DSS for payment processing
Support up to 1,000 concurrent users initially

tickets.title: Set up AWS infrastructure
tickets.description: Create and configure the AWS infrastructure to support the Course Enrollment Platform, ensuring it can handle up to 1,000 concurrent users while staying within the $150 monthly budget. This includes setting up EC2 instances for the application server and RDS for PostgreSQL.
acceptanceCriteria: AWS EC2 instances are running and accessible
AWS RDS instance is running PostgreSQL and accessible
Infrastructure cost estimation does not exceed $150 per month

tickets.title: Implement user authentication
tickets.description: Develop a secure user authentication system allowing students and admins to log in and access the platform. This system will support features like registration, login, and password management.
acceptanceCriteria: Given valid credentials, users can log in
Given invalid credentials, users cannot log in and see an error
Users can register for a new account
Users can reset their password if forgotten

tickets.title: Develop course catalog API
tickets.description: Create RESTful API endpoints to manage (CRUD operations) the course catalog. This will allow admins to add, update, delete, and list courses and students to view the available courses.
acceptanceCriteria: Admins can create, update, and delete courses
Students and guests can view the list of courses
Each course entry includes title, description, price, and availability status

tickets.title: Implement search functionality
tickets.description: Enable a search feature for students to find courses by keywords. This involves indexing course information and implementing a search query interface.
acceptanceCriteria: Given a keyword, the system returns a list of courses matching the keyword
Search results include course title, description, and price
Search is performant under load of up to 1,000 concurrent users

tickets.title: Create shopping cart functionality
tickets.description: Develop the shopping cart functionality that allows students to add courses to their cart, view their cart, update quantities, or remove courses before checkout.
acceptanceCriteria: Students can add courses to their cart
Students can view their cart contents
Students can update the quantity of courses in their cart
Students can remove courses from their cart

tickets.title: Integrate Stripe for payment processing
tickets.description: Integrate Stripe to handle secure payment processing for course enrollments. Ensure the integration complies with PCI-DSS requirements.
acceptanceCriteria: Students can enter and submit payment information for courses in their cart
Payment information is processed securely in compliance with PCI-DSS
Upon successful payment, the student is enrolled in the course

tickets.title: Build admin dashboard for course management
tickets.description: Create an admin dashboard interface for managing the course catalog, including adding, updating, and removing courses.
acceptanceCriteria: Admins can log in to access the dashboard
Admins can add, update, and delete courses
Changes are reflected in real-time on the student-facing site

tickets.title: Implement finance report generation
tickets.description: Develop a feature for generating finance reports based on course enrollments and payments. Reports should be accessible to the finance team with appropriate permissions.
acceptanceCriteria: Finance team can generate reports on demand
Reports include total enrollments and revenue by course
Reports can be exported in CSV format

pros: Breaks down the project into manageable, logically sequenced tasks.
Ensures that dependencies are clearly identified, facilitating smooth workflow and minimizing bottlenecks.
Balances the workload across backend and frontend development, allowing for parallel progress.
Prioritizes critical features for the MVP, aligning with the project timeline and goals.
cons: Some tickets may be underestimated or overestimated due to the complexity of integrating third-party services like Stripe.
Dependencies could create delays if any of the prerequisite tasks encounter issues.
The effort to stay within the budget constraint for AWS infrastructure might require revisiting and optimization post-MVP, not accounted for in the current tickets.
alternatives: Grouping related features into epics (e.g., all payment-related tasks under a 'Payment Processing' epic) to provide a higher-level view of progress.
Using a Kanban board for managing dependencies more visually, which can help in adjusting priorities on the fly.
